business.headline: Will central government employees' dearness allowance reach 60%?The government revises the DA/DR rates twice a year, effective from January 1 and July 1. However, the official announcement generally comes a few months later.
Sensex closes 271 points higher, Nifty above 25,500; Kotak Bank up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 270 points to end at 83,712.51, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 61.20 points to close at 25,522.50.

Fincluencer explains why India's rich are planning to retire abroadIndia's rich are rethinking where they retire and how they invest. Finfluencer Akshat Shrivastava says it's not a whim but a calculated response to India's tax structure on wealth and income.

Earning Rs 80,000 a month and still broke? Finance coach explains what's wrongMany in their 20s and 30s are earning more than generations before, but their money often disappears into lifestyle upgrades, digital conveniences, and impulse-driven choices. The result is a sense of helplessness despite a good paycheck.

Bill Gates no longer in world's top 10 richest; trails former Microsoft CEOBill Gates now ranks behind Michael Dell, who is at number 11 with $137 billion, and Steve Ballmer, his former Microsoft colleague, who is far ahead at number 5 with $172 billion.

All you need to know about UAE's Golden Visa: Cost, application, documentationUnlike earlier Golden Visas that required big investments in property or business, this new scheme allows skilled professionals to apply based on their talent and work experience.

Jane Street vs Sebi: All you need to know about the caseAt the heart of the controversy is a long-running investigation into the firm's index arbitrage strategy, one that Jane Street insists is standard and legal, but which Sebi believes may have distorted prices in India's rapidly growing equity derivatives market.
Filed your ITR early? Will you get a faster tax refund?Filing an ITR early improves your chances of a quicker refund, but only if your return is correct, complete and verified on time.
Insured, but still deniedIn Part 2 of our series on India's insurance crisis, we explore why, for thousands of Indians, having a policy doesn't mean having protection when it matters most.

Jane Street to challenge Sebi trading ban, slams charges as inflammatory: ReportIn an internal email to staff over the weekend, the US-based firm said it was "beyond disappointed" by Sebi's accusations, which it described as "extremely inflammatory."

Have lost their tax edge: Expert sounds the alarm on ULIPsThe tax expert said ULIPs no longer guarantee tax-free returns. Investors paying over Rs 2.5 lakh annually may face capital gains tax—making mutual funds a more efficient alternative.
Sensex opens 65 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; Kotak Bank up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was up by 72.04 points to 83,514.54, while the NSE Nifty50 added 16.50 points to 25,477.80 as of 9:40 am.

entertainment.headline: Sweet Home's Lee Si-young announces IVF pregnancy, chooses single motherhoodK-drama star Lee Si-young is embarking on the 'miraculous' journey of motherhood once again, this time, with a heart free of worries or regrets. Here's all you need to know.

How female actors are stripping off their damsel in distress stereotype in cinemaFrom dodging bullets to delivering blows, female actors have completely changed the action game. No longer damsel in distress, they aren't just breaking stereotypes, they're rewriting the rulebook, one punch at a time.

Shabana Azmi, Javed Akhtar fly Air India to Wimbledon, express faith in the airlineShabana Azmi and Javed Akhtar are off to Wimbledon. The couple have reinstated their faith in Air India as they chose the airline for travel.

Metro… In Dino's melody hits the right notes, but KK's absence echoes loudly'Metro… In Dino' delivers emotional depth and strong performances, but without KK's iconic voice, the soundtrack feels incomplete, and here's why we think so.

Divyanka is unapologetically silly in love with Vivek. See anniversary postDivyanka Tripathi marks her ninth wedding anniversary with Vivek Dahiya, sharing a heartfelt post on Instagram. The couple, who met on the sets of 'Yeh Hai Mohabbatein', have been cherished by fans for their enduring relationship.

Smriti Irani gets a massive pay hike for Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi rebootAs actor-turned-politician Smriti Irani gears up to make her TV comeback, her compensation for the show has reportedly increased significantly. She was paid Rs 1,800 per episode when the show first aired in 2000.

After Kareena Kapoor, Neena Gupta calls out Prada over Kolhapuri footwear row Actor Neena Gupta joined Kareena Kapoor in calling out Prada for allegedly copying the design of traditional Kolhapuri chappals in their latest collection.

Saiyami Kher becomes first Indian actor to complete Ironman 70.3 twice in a yearSaiyami Kher has become the first Indian actor to complete the Ironman 70.3 triathlon twice in less than a year. She finished her second race in Sweden with a faster time.

Ananya Panday cheers for Shanaya Kapoor ahead of Aankhon Ki Gustaakhiyan releaseAhead of 'Aankhon Ki Gustaakhiyan' release, actor Ananya Panday cheered for debutant Shanaya Kapoor on Instagram. She also shared that she loves the song 'Alvida' from the upcoming film.

Aamir Khan hosted Jwala Gutta for 10 months during her IVF journey: Vishnu VishalAamir Khan helped actor Vishnu Vishal and badminton player Jwala Gutta by directing them to a doctor who specialises in IVF. In a recent interview, Vishnu also revealed that Jwala stayed at Aamir's Mumbai house throughout her pregnancy.

Raveena Tandon fumes at crew for secretly recording Shraddha Kapoor, Rahul ModyActor Raveena Tandon recently slammed a cabin crew member for secretly filming Shraddha Kapoor and her rumoured boyfriend Rahul Mody. Although the clip was originally recorded in February, it has resurfaced on social media.

Raha is his dal chawal: Ranbir's Ramayana co-star recalls set conversationRamayana actor Indira Krishnan spoke about actor Ranbir Kapoor's bond with his daughter Raha in a recent interview. She said Kapoor once told her that Raha is his dal chawal.

R Madhavan on Bollywood's shift to age-appropriate romances: Woh zamana gayaActor R Madhavan discusses the end of older heroes romancing younger heroines in Bollywood. His film 'Aap Jaisa Koi' explores modern love and loneliness beyond age differences.

Apoorva Mukhija's parents compared her to Deepika Padukone after India's Got Latent rowInfluencer Apoorva Mukhija told filmmaker Farah Khan how her parents reacted to the 'India's Got Latent' controversy. She also shared her initial reaction to the backlash she received for her controversial remarks.

Shreya Ghoshal melts hearts as she sings Piyu Bole for pregnant fanDuring her Amsterdam tour stop, Indian playback singer Shreya Ghoshal shared a touching moment with an expectant mother by singing 'Piyu Bole' to her unborn child. This heartfelt gesture has gone viral on social media, showcasing Ghoshal's warmth and deep connection with her fans.

Pamela Anderson opens up about why she doesn't want to be known as a sex symbolActor Pamela Anderson recently shared that she doesn't want to be associated with her sex symbol title. She mentioned that it can be scary, and it makes her uncomfortable.

Unni Mukundan's Instagram hacked, actor warns against suspicious activityMalayalam actor Unni Mukundan has warned his fans that his official Instagram account has been hacked and urged caution against interacting with any messages from it. He is actively working with relevant teams to regain control and promises to update followers only through verified channels.

When it rains in Bollywood... magic unfolds and stories transformBollywood filmmakers have long used rain not just as a backdrop, but as a powerful emotional tool, a silent character that enhances love, heartbreak, transformation, and nostalgia. From 'Metro... In Dino' to 'Jab We Met', these iconic rain moments continue to stir hearts and shape stories.

Nick Jonas calls Priyanka Chopra saint, shares parenting lessonsNick Jonas recently opened up about fatherhood and called wife Priyanka Chopra a 'saint' while sharing parenting lessons. He praised Priyanka as an amazing partner who makes his journey as a father even more special.

general news.headline: Dreamliner among safest aircraft, over 1,000 flying: Air India on Ahmedabad crashAir India's defence came during a PAC meeting that was originally scheduled to discuss "levy charges at airports" but turned into a tense session over the June 12 crash.

Murma ji and Covid: Congress chief's gaffes on Presidents' names leave BJP furiousMallikarjun Kharge, speaking in Chhattisgarh, could be heard referring to the President as 'Murma ji'. Seconds later, he did a gaffe again, mispronouncing 'Kovind' as 'Covid'.

Kerala couple dupe Bengaluru investors in multi-crore chit fund scam, abscondingA Kerala couple allegedly behind a decades-long chit fund scam in Bengaluru has gone missing after investors stopped receiving promised returns. Police have launched a manhunt and registered a case.

Lost in translation: How India's language politics misses the scriptThe politics of language more often than not gets hijacked by party street thugs whose leaders fail to capture the voter's imagination legitimately.

Seine greets swimmers in Paris after 100 years. Will Delhi pass Yamuna test?The Seine, which flows through the heart of Paris, was sick for 100 years. For the first time since 1923, people were allowed to swim in the Seine. This is after an extensive clean-up of the river. The Yamuna is similarly polluted in Delhi. With Delhi CM Rekha Gupta intensifying the push, will Delhiites get to swim in the Yamuna anytime soon?

Woman gang-raped in train in Haryana, thrown on tracks, loses legThe survivor told the police that she was approached by a man at Panipat railway station, who claimed he had been sent by her husband. She further informed the police that she was taken into an empty coach of a stationary train and raped by him. Subsequently, two other men joined in and also raped her.

Novak Djokovic acknowledges Virat Kohli's 'gladiator' shoutout: Thank YouFormer World No. 1 Novak Djokovic thanked Virat Kohli for his support during his round-of-16 clash with Alex de Minaur. Kohli, clearly captivated by Djokovic's resilience on Centre Court, hailed the Serb as a "gladiator."

Expired Valium at home? Drug regulator lists 17 unused medicines to flush nowThat half-used strip of pills in your medicine cabinet isn't just clutter, it could be deadly. India's top drug regulator warns that expired medications can be fatal if taken by someone they weren't meant for. This isn't just a health advisory by CDSCO, it's an urgent call to action
Insured, but still deniedIn Part 2 of our series on India's insurance crisis, we explore why, for thousands of Indians, having a policy doesn't mean having protection when it matters most.

Politicians act like kings: Madras High Court raps ex-minister for vulgar speechThe Madras High Court criticised former DMK Minister K Ponmudy for his derogatory remarks against Vaishnavites, Saivites, and women. Justice Velmurugan warned of a possible CBI probe if police fail to act. The final decision is set for July 8, 2025.

Speeding Hayabusa biker crashes into Zomato delivery rider in Mysuru, both dieA Hayabusa superbike rider collided with a Zomato delivery bike in Mysuru on July 6. The crash, captured on CCTV, left both riders dead. Police have registered a case and launched an investigation.
All Indian languages are national languages: RSS amid Hindi imposition rowThe statement, made at a recent meeting of the RSS, comes amid an ongoing language row in Maharashtra and Tamil Nadu.

OnePlus Nord 5 review: True value for money phoneThe OnePlus Nord 5 series has been launched in India, with the Nord 5 being the company's latest offering for users looking for a reliable mid-range smartphone under Rs 40,000. In this review, let's explore what the fifth generation of the Nord smartphone offers and whether it truly delivers the value it promises on paper.

What made Meta's $100 million AI hires irresistible, and how you can followMeta is pouring up to $100 million into top AI talent from OpenAI, DeepMind, and Anthropic. Here's more about their education, skills, and career moves which can offer a blueprint for aspiring AI experts.

Metro… In Dino's melody hits the right notes, but KK's absence echoes loudly'Metro… In Dino' delivers emotional depth and strong performances, but without KK's iconic voice, the soundtrack feels incomplete, and here's why we think so.

Fashion veteran Sunil Sethi on Prada-Kolhapuri row: 'We deserve acknowledgement'In an exclusive conversation with India Today, Fashion Design Council of India chairman Sunil Sethi shared his views on the Prada-Kolhapuri controversy.

Virat Kohli's Wimbledon trip a problem? Let him watch, without being watchedVirat Kohli watching Wimbledon at the iconic Centre Court on Monday has upset a few. The former India captain was rooting for Novak Djokovic in his fourth-round match. Can't Kohli even watch tennis now?

Do you know who my dad is? I'll buy you: MNS leader's son 'threatened' influencerSocial media influencer Rajshree More claimed that Rahil Shaikh kept repeating that his father's name was Javed Shaikh throughout the confrontation. "Do you know who my father is? Who are you? I can buy you. How much money do you want?" she claimed Rahil said to her.

Shux tells students how astronauts sleep in space where Sun rises 16 timesConnecting directly from the International Space Station (ISS), Shukla shared firsthand experiences about the unique challenges of living, and sleeping in space.

Watch: Andreeva starstruck as Roger Federer attends her Wimbledon winWimbledon 2025: Russian tennis star Mirra Andreeva fulfilled a lifelong dream when 20-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer watched her match from the iconic Royal Box at SW19 on Monday.

Indian woman defends strapping toddler to leash in US after video sparks debateAn Indian mother sparked debate online after she shared a video of her 3.5-year-old son on a leash during a family holiday in New York City.

Zohran Mamdani's old tweet showing middle finger to Columbus statue sparks new rowA 2020 tweet in which he is seen showing the middle finger to a statue of Christopher Columbus has infuriated the Italian-American voter base, which makes up 8 percent of New York City's electorate,

Bhagwant Mann backs Diljit amid Sardaar Ji 3 row: Film shot before J&K attackFacing boycott calls over casting Pakistani actor Hania Aamir in Sardaar Ji 3, Diljit Dosanjh has found support from Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann, who said the film was shot before the Pahalgam terror attack.

Nitish Kumar's big 35% jobs quota for Bihar women, NDA in poll overdriveAhead of the Assembly polls, Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar announced a 35% reservation for local women in all state government jobs and approved the formation of a new Bihar Youth Commission.

No longer damsel in distress, they aren't just breaking stereotypes, they're rewriting the rulebook, one punch at a time.

sports.headline: Mbappe drops moral harassment case against PSG and seeks reconciliationKylian Mbappe has dropped the moral harassment case against Paris Saint-Germain, and the Frenchman seeks reconciliation with his former club.

Virat Kohli makes Wimbledon 2025 prediction: I want Novak Djokovic to winVirat Kohli, speaking from the Center Court at Wimbledon, backed Novak Djokovic to play Carlos Alcaraz in the men's singles final and beat the Spaniard for his 25th Grand Slam title.

No Babar, Rizwan, Shaheen as Pakistan announce squad for Bangladesh T20I seriesThere was no place for Babar Azam, Mohammad Rizwan and Shaheen Shah Afridi as Pakistan announced the squad for the upcoming T20I series against Bangladesh.

Watch: Andreeva starstruck as Roger Federer attends her Wimbledon winWimbledon 2025: Russian tennis star Mirra Andreeva fulfilled a lifelong dream when 20-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer watched her match from the iconic Royal Box at SW19 on Monday.

Why Tim David isn't chasing an ODI return? Australian batter explains decisionTim David is in no rush to return to the ODI setup as Australia enter a period of transition with their 50-over side following the retirements of big names. David said that his current focus is on T20s.

Novak Djokovic acknowledges Virat Kohli's 'gladiator' shoutout: Thank YouFormer World No. 1 Novak Djokovic thanked Virat Kohli for his support during his round-of-16 clash with Alex de Minaur. Kohli, clearly captivated by Djokovic's resilience on Centre Court, hailed the Serb as a "gladiator."

Shubman Gill batted like Don Bradman in 2nd Test, captaincy 10 out of 10: Ravi ShastriRavi Shastri heaped praise on Shubman Gill for his batting prowess and captaincy skills during India's win in the second Test against England. Gill scored twin centuries as India handed England a big defeat to level the series.

Lord's Test vs India will be Ben Stokes' toughest challenge as captain: AthertonMichael Atherton believes the Lord's Test will be a stern challenge for Ben Stokes' England captaincy after the heavy Edgbaston defeat. The upcoming match will be a test of Stokes' leadership and resilience, according to Atherton.

Shubman Gill batted like Don Bradman in 2nd Test, captaincy 10 out of 10: Ravi ShastriRavi Shastri heaped praise on Shubman Gill for his batting prowess and captaincy skills during India's win in the second Test against England. Gill scored twin centuries as India handed England a big defeat to level the series.

Lord's Test vs India will be Ben Stokes' toughest challenge as captain: AthertonMichael Atherton believes the Lord's Test will be a stern challenge for Ben Stokes' England captaincy after the heavy Edgbaston defeat. The upcoming match will be a test of Stokes' leadership and resilience, according to Atherton.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
